sorular.soru: Who is liable for a 15-year-old child who is not wearing a seat belt?

feedback.metin: If passengers under 12 years old are not wearing a seat belt, the driver is liable. Passengers from the age of 12 are responsible for wearing a seat belt themselves. Seat belts must be used when driving forwards and backwards, but also when waiting.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive at 50 km/h here?

feedback.metin: This sign indicates a recommended speed. It is therefore not mandatory to drive 30 km/h and 50 km/h is allowed. But this sign is often used to indicate a safe speed under favourable weather conditions. It is therefore wise to adhere to this, as the sign is here for a reason.

sorular.soru: What should you do here?
cevaplar: You stop to be able to see if you have to give way in time.
You keep driving at the same speed because you have priority.
You approach the intersection carefully because it is a dangerous point.
sorular.dogruCevap: You approach the intersection carefully because it is a dangerous point.

feedback.metin: If you are approaching a traffic light with the yellow light flashing, this means that the traffic light is out of order. At that moment, the signs that govern the right of way are valid. You, therefore, have right of way. But because traffic lights normally regulate this situation, not all drivers will be immediately aware of this. Therefore, approach the point carefully and confirm you have right of way. Drive on as soon as you can.

sorular.soru: Should you stop here?

feedback.metin: The military convoy is approaching a red traffic light. Because the front vehicle of the convoy is approaching this traffic light, the whole military convoy has to stop. In this case, you do not have to give priority to the convoy. You only have to give priority to the convoy if the first vehicle crossed at a green light.

sorular.soru: Can you drive onto this road to deliver something to a resident?

feedback.metin: The upper sign indicates that the road is closed to all motor vehicles. The bottom sign indicates that the sign above it does not apply to destination traffic. However, you may drive on this road if your destination is here, for example if you are visiting someone or delivering something.

sorular.soru: Can you overtake on the right here?
cevaplar: Yes. Overtaking is allowed in this lane.
Only in case of a traffic jam.
No. Overtaking on the right is never allowed.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. Overtaking is allowed in this lane.

feedback.metin: An acceleration lane, deceleration lane or combined acceleration and deceleration lane (weaving lane) is a section of road separated from the main carriageway by a block marking and intended for drivers wishing to enter or leave the main carriageway. To facilitate traffic flow, you may overtake to the right of the block marking.

sorular.soru: What is the allowed width of a passenger car?

feedback.metin: A passenger car may not exceed 2.55 metres wide, 4 metres high, and 12 metres long.

sorular.soru: What traffic behaviour is expected of you here?
cevaplar: Stay calm and go to the right if possible.
Brake lightly to scare the tailgater.
Drive faster to leave more space behind you.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stay calm and go to the right if possible.

feedback.metin: Tailgating is prohibited. If someone is tailgating you, stay calm and maintain your speed, and keep to the right if possible. Do not use your brakes to warn or scare the tailgater. If this results in an accident, you will face criminal prosecution.

sorular.soru: What does this sign mean?

feedback.metin: This sign indicates a pedestrian crossing. Drivers must give way to pedestrians and drivers of disabled vehicles who are crossing or about to cross a pedestrian crossing.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: A person moving around by means of a walker, cane or crutches falls under a ‘person with difficulty moving around’. It is compulsory to give way to persons who have difficulty moving around when crossing. Even if they do not use a pedestrian crossing. If a person moves forward in a wheelchair or disabled vehicle, this rule does not apply.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here?

feedback.metin: Stopping on the right-hand side of the road is prohibited. You are allowed to stop on the left-hand side of the road.

sorular.soru: Can you drop off a passenger here?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to wait next to a solid yellow line, so you cannot wait or stop to pick up or drop off a passenger, or load or unload goods.

sorular.soru: What should you do if you drive into a fog bank?
cevaplar: Brake immediately and increase following distance.
Release the accelerator and increase the following distance.
sorular.dogruCevap: Release the accelerator and increase the following distance.

feedback.metin: Under normal road and weather conditions, you can maintain a following distance of 2 seconds. In bad weather conditions, such as heavy rainfall or fog banks, you must adjust your speed and keep a longer following distance of 3, 4 or sometimes even more seconds. Do not brake hard immediately, but release the accelerator and slowly reduce your speed.

sorular.soru: Up to what weight can a bicycle carrier on a tow bar be loaded?
cevaplar: Up to the maximum axle load minus the weight of the bicycle carrier itself.
Up to the maximum tow ball weight minus the weight of the bicycle carrier itself.
Up to the maximum tow load minus the weight of the bicycle carrier itself.
sorular.dogruCevap: Up to the maximum tow ball weight minus the weight of the bicycle carrier itself.

feedback.metin: A bicycle carrier with bicycles may never exceed the maximum tow ball weight. You may load the tow bar with the maximum tow ball weight specified by the manufacturer of the tow bar. This weight is usually shown on a plate on the tow bar or on the papers supplied with the tow bar. Usually, this weight is between 45 kg (for small cars) and 75 kg (for large cars). If there is no maximum tow ball weight specified by the manufacturer, a maximum of 75 kg applies. This weight therefore applies to both the bicycles and the bicycle carrier together.

sorular.soru: If you are pushing a broken down car, does the law classify you as a driver?

feedback.metin: You are classified as a driver when you drive a car. If you push a car, you are driving it and you remain a driver, even if you are no longer in it. This does not apply if you are pushing a bicycle, moped or motorcycle by hand while walking. In this case, you are a pedestrian.

sorular.soru: Should you expect the snorfietser to ride on the carriageway?

feedback.metin: Snorfietsers must follow the rules that apply to cyclists. They must use the cycle path. The sign only directs moped and speed pedelec riders to the carriageway; they are not allowed to continue riding on the cycle path. So you do not have to expect that the snorfietser will enter the carriageway.

sorular.soru: You want to report a serious accident by phone. Are you allowed to stop here?

feedback.metin: You are only allowed to use the hard shoulder, layby or verge in case of emergency. Reporting a serious accident falls under an emergency, and is therefore allowed here. Do keep in mind your own safety and do not stay here longer than necessary.

sorular.soru: Together, your car with trailer is 9 metres long. Are you allowed to overtake the vehicle in front of you?

feedback.metin: When your car and trailer together is longer than 7 metres, you are only allowed to drive on the two rightmost lanes of the motorway. There are only two lanes open at the moment, so you are allowed to use them both. The hard shoulder is not used as a lane right now and therefore does not count as a lane. You are allowed to overtake the vehicle in front of you. Do keep in mind that your maximum allowed speed is 90 km/h.

sorular.soru: What is the best thing to do if you are blinded by the lights of the vehicle behind you?
cevaplar: Set the rearview mirror to dimming position.
sorular.dogruCevap: Set the rearview mirror to dimming position.

feedback.metin: If you are blinded by the bright light of a moving vehicle behind you, stay calm and set the rearview mirror to the dimming position. Do not perform dangerous and prohibited manoeuvres by suddenly applying the brake or turning on the hazard lights.

sorular.soru: Can you wait for a passenger here?

feedback.metin: This area is designated for the loading and unloading of goods or the immediate picking up or dropping off of passengers. Waiting for passengers is classed as parking and is not allowed here.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the pedestrians?

feedback.metin: Drivers are not allowed to proceed when there is oncoming traffic. Pedestrians are also categorised as traffic. You must give way to any oncoming traffic, i.e. the black arrow goes before the red arrow.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the tram turning off?

feedback.metin: Trams are tied to a fixed track and therefore less manoeuvrable, which is why different rules apply to trams. Regardless of where they are coming from, you must always give way to trams, unless you are on a priority road and the tram is not.

sorular.soru: You want to go straight ahead. Do you have to give way to the motorcyclist?

feedback.metin: You do not have to give way to the motorcyclist. The motorcyclist and you are on the same road. The motorcyclist wants to turn off and you go straight ahead. Through traffic on the same road goes before traffic turning off.

sorular.soru: Is this the correct way to walk around the vehicle to your door?

feedback.metin: If you want to get into the vehicle, it is better and safer to walk around the front of the vehicle. This way, you are able to see any approaching traffic. The road must be clear, as you may not obstruct other traffic when opening your vehicle door.

sorular.soru: Who is responsible for doing the APK on time?
cevaplar: The driver and the owner or keeper.
sorular.dogruCevap: The driver and the owner or keeper.

feedback.metin: Passenger cars have to be checked every once in a while. This is the Periodic General Inspection (also APK). Both the driver as well as the owner or holder of a passenger car is responsible for having this inspection done on time.

sorular.soru: In what situation is it wise to run full-beam headlights?

feedback.metin: You are only allowed to run the full-beam headlights at night, if you do not hinder other road users when doing so. However, it is better not to turn on the headlights in fog, because you will blind yourself. Therefore it is only wise to run full-beam headlights in situation A.

sorular.soru: When do you get a newly qualified driving licence?
cevaplar: Each time you obtain a new driving licence category.
When you obtain a driving licence for the first time.
Only when you are younger than 23 years.
sorular.dogruCevap: When you obtain a driving licence for the first time.

feedback.metin: Everyone who obtains a driving licence for the first time is issued a newly qualified driving licence. It does not matter how old you are or which licence you have obtained. The newly qualified driving licence is valid for up to 5 years after obtaining your first licence. If you are under the age of 18 and you obtain the AM or T driving licence, you will retain the newly qualified driving licence for 7 years. This period does not start again for each subsequent driving licence category.

sorular.soru: Which section of the road can you see with a properly adjusted side-view mirror?

feedback.metin: Section A can be seen with a properly adjusted side-view mirror. Section B, however, cannot. This section is called the blind spot and can only be seen by turning your head.

sorular.soru: Should you take a longer stopping distance into account during winter?

feedback.metin: Your stopping distance depends on both the weather and your speed. In bad weather and on roads that are slippery due to frost, snow, or sleet, you must take a longer stopping distance into account. During winter, there is a high risk of frost, snow, and black ice. Also bear in mind that other traffic will experience a longer stopping distance. Therefore, adjust your speed.

sorular.soru: Is the headrest adjusted properly?

feedback.metin: The top of the headrest must be as high as the top of the driver's head. The headrest is set too low here.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light comes on?
cevaplar: Stop in a safe place and check the lighting.
Nothing. It means you have switched the lights on.
Stop immediately and call the breakdown service.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop in a safe place and check the lighting.

feedback.metin: This light means that there is a defect in the lighting. You do not have to stop right away, but find a safe place and stop there, for example, in a car park. Check the lighting for broken lamps and replace them if possible. Always ensure you have spare bulbs available. If you cannot replace the bulb yourself, have it replaced at a garage as soon as possible.

sorular.soru: What should you do here?
cevaplar: Move to the right as soon as it is possible.
Move up one lane to the left.
sorular.dogruCevap: Move up one lane to the left.

feedback.metin: The electronic matrix signs indicate that the lane must be cleared further on because a red cross will follow. The lorries must therefore leave this lane. There is plenty of room on the left, so the best thing to do is move up one lane to the left to create space for the lorries.

sorular.soru: You do not want to get in lane, but want to follow the weaving lane. When do you indicate your direction of travel?
cevaplar: You do not indicate direction, you only do that if you want to get in lane.
Just before the first arrow on the road surface of the weaving lane.
Just before the weaving lane and the main carriageway join together.
sorular.dogruCevap: Just before the weaving lane and the main carriageway join together.

feedback.metin: A weaving lane is a combined acceleration and deceleration lane. If you approach a road via this weaving lane and you do not want to get in lane, you turn on your indicator to the right. You especially do this if the weaving lane and the  main carriageway join together. This way traffic on the main carriageway knows you do not want to get in lane.

sorular.soru: Can it be mandatory to use a warning triangle in the event of a breakdown?

feedback.metin: If you come to a stop due to a breakdown on the road and pose a possible danger to other drivers, you are required to use your hazard lights and/or a warning triangle. If your hazard lights do not work, you are required to use a warning triangle. This also applies if your vehicle is not clearly visible even with the use of hazard lights, for instance after a bend or a hill.

sorular.soru: At what engine speed should you shift to a higher gear?

feedback.metin: It is best to shift up to a higher gear at around 2000 RPM. This can lead to considerable fuel savings. If your vehicle is heavily loaded, or if you have to accelerate quickly, do not change gears until you have reached a slightly higher RPM. When you have to change gears also depends on the type of vehicle. However, changing gears below 1500 RPM or above 2500 RPM is too early or too late for almost all vehicles, respectively.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to move to the right here?

feedback.metin: The solid line between your lane and the right-hand lane is on your side of the broken line. This means that you are not allowed to cross it. It has been placed here to prevent drivers getting in lane getting in a tight spot with drivers that move from the left lane to the right.

sorular.soru: Can you top up engine oil yourself?
cevaplar: No. This can only be done by a mechanic.
Yes. But only after you have checked the oil level.
No. Only if a red warning indicator lights up.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. But only after you have checked the oil level.

feedback.metin: Regularly checking the car's oil level is recommended. If you notice a drop in the oil level, you can top up the oil yourself. Make sure you use the right oil and do not refill too much at once. Too much oil, just like too little, is not good for the engine. More information can be found in the car's instruction manual.

sorular.soru: How long is a driving licence valid if you are younger than 65?

feedback.metin: A driving licence is valid for 10 years from the date of issue. This applies up to the age of 65. If you renew your driving licence between the ages of 65 and 70, it is valid up to the age of 75. From the age of 70, it is only valid for a maximum of 5 years and from the age of 75, a medical examination is required for every renewal.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake here?

feedback.metin: You are approaching an intersection with a bad view on the side road on the right. Overtaking is dangerous here and therefore prohibited.

sorular.soru: Are you positioned properly?

feedback.metin: You can wait like this to improve the flow of traffic. This is only allowed if you are not blocking other traffic flows, posing any danger, or causing hinder.

sorular.soru: What should you do in this situation?
cevaplar: Drive as fast as possible so that the ambulance can also go faster.
Keep driving at the allowed speed limit.
Slow down and drive into the verge as slowly as possible.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep driving at the allowed speed limit.

feedback.metin: You may not violate any traffic rules by exceeding the speed limit and you must not endanger yourself by driving into the verge. Keep driving in your own lane and keep driving at the same speed. The ambulance will wait for a safe place to overtake.
